mprSheetExport.Description: Export (print) selected sheets to PDF, DWG, etc. with automatic sheet format detection
mprSheetExport.h1: The trial period of the plugin is over! Purchase a license or a Revit subscription to continue using the "Sheet export" plugin
mprSheetExport.h32: Number of sheets selected for export
mprSheetExport.h34: Number of sheets for which the format could not be determined
mprSheetExport.h36: Number of sheets for which the nearest format is selected
mprSheetExport.h38: The export directory already contains files with the same names as the export sheets. Select an action:
mprSheetExport.h39: Exclude Title Blocks from processing. Specify, separated by commas without spaces, the values that must be contained in the names of the Title Blocks (family name or type name) that do not need to be processed by the plugin:
mprSheetExport.h43: Sheet formats have been added. You need to restart Revit.
mprSheetExport.h45: Try again or abort the export?
mprSheetExport.h50: Create subdirectories by export format type
mprSheetExport.h51: Create subdirectories by sheet group names
mprSheetExport.h53: Sheet format does not fit into any of the supported print formats
mprSheetExport.h54: For the Sheet Format, the closest largest printing format is selected
mprSheetExport.h55: Edit the list of colors that will not be converted to black and white
mprSheetExport.h62: The print format is determined by the entire contents of the Sheet. After the Sheet is printed to pdf, it is trimmed to fit the size of the Title Block. This algorithm can cause regeneration of all sheets, which can lead to long loading of the plugin
mprSheetExport.h63: The print format is determined by the size of the Title Blocks on the Sheets. If there are elements on the Sheet that exceed the border of the Title Block, the Sheet will be printed incorrectly in the pdf. This algorithm does not cause regeneration of Sheets
mprSheetExport.h65: Combine sheets into one dwf file
mprSheetExport.h67: If the option is disabled, the export will continue until all sheets are processed
mprSheetExport.h70: Rooms, spaces and areas in a separate boundary layer
mprSheetExport.h71: Texture settings for render appearences of materials
mprSheetExport.h79: Read sheets with saved settings when the plugin starts
mprSheetExport.h80: Enter the name of the new configuration
mprSheetExport.h83: Are you sure you want to delete the "{0}" configuration?
mprSheetExport.h87: Example of full export directory path:
mprSheetExport.h90: Cannot create export directory – invalid path specified!
mprSheetExport.h91: Select which documents to process (if any), select the format detection algorithm and click "Read Sheets"
mprSheetExport.h94: Enter name for the Print Set
mprSheetExport.h96: Enter Print Set name already in use
mprSheetExport.h98: The File Name Mask does not contain the sheet parameters, which may result in generating the same file name for all exported sheets. When you create a file name mask, make sure that the file names will be unique
mprSheetExport.h101: You can add any system variable to the mask by enclosing it with a % symbol. For example, %OS%
mprSheetExport.h104: Activating the "Limit number of characters" option may result in identical file names if the initial part of the names of different sheets has the same value within the length limit. In this case the export will result in one file with the contents of the last processed sheet. If you activate the "Limit number of characters" option, make sure that the file names will be unique
mprSheetExport.h107: When creating a custom format, make sure that the entered format sizes are acceptable for the selected pdf printer
mprSheetExport.h118: Export views on sheets and links as external references
mprSheetExport.h121: Apply selected action in the future
mprSheetExport.h124: Temporary mode handling (hiding/isolating or showing hidden elements) of views
mprSheetExport.h125: View links in blue (Color prints only)
mprSheetExport.h135: Determine the print format of this sheet over the entire contents of a Revit Sheet. This function should be used if the Sheet contains elements that exceed the border of the Title Block. Causes the sheet to regenerate
mprSheetExport.h137: Export to PDF of the current sheet of the current document ignoring the checked export formats
mprSheetExport.h138: Do not add the index of a composite sheet (a sheet with more than one Title Block) to the file name if only one composite sheet is exported
mprSheetExport.h139: Retry to create a merged PDF file?
mprSheetExport.h145: When this option is enabled, sheets placed in assemblies will be grouped separately from the main sheets
mprSheetExport.h147: Open the export folder when the export is complete:
mprSheetExport.h150: Export to the document location directory
mprSheetExport.h151: If the document does not have a location directory defined, the export will be done to the specified Export directory. If the specified Export directory does not exist, the document export will be skipped
mprSheetExport.h152: Display the name generated by the mask in the sheet tree
mprSheetExport.h157: Set the sheet reading settings and click the "Read Sheets" button
mprSheetExport.h158: The File Name Mask is set by your organization's settings, is independent of the selected configuration, and cannot be changed
mprSheetExport.h159: The parameter value is taken from the first checked sheet of the exported document!
mprSheetExport.h160: Use to output sheets to PDF:
mprSheetExport.h169: Remove Unicode control characters from the filename
mprSheetExport.sv1: %yyyy% – The year as a four-digit number
mprSheetExport.sv3: %dd% – The day of the month, from 01 through 31
mprSheetExport.sv4: %HH% – The hour, using a 24-hour clock from 00 to 23
